page.title: 01AREA WEST OF WIVELISCOMBE
page.content:
This rural,unspoilt part of Somerset is mainly grazing farmland,but includes some woodland (recently used for pheasant rearing), and the western edge of the old market town of Wiveliscombe.The village of Chipstable, with its 14th century church, is to the west.
The nearest towns are Taunton (17km to the east),Milverton and Wellington. To the north,the Bristol Channel is 16km away at the port of Watchet.
Wiveliscombe Recreation Ground is the home of thriving Cricket,Rugby and Tennis clubs, and there ia an outdoor swimming pool. There are many interesting walks and picturesque views. Bulland Ford and Washbattle Mills may both be seen during a walk along the River Tone.
